content: mushroom or fairy house chanterelle fly agaric porcini when you were younger did you ever play the game mushroom or fairy house i certainly did i would wander the beautiful valley where i grew up in the south island of new zealand and look under every mushroom in hopes of finding one with a tiny door and an even tinier welcome mat this design is my attempt to stay connected to my fairytale like childhood my hope is that i never get so old and serious that i stop looking for fairy doors under mushrooms because hunting for fairies is almost as much fun as finding them copyright 2023 version 2 april 2025 by natasha hanson all rights reserved 1 construction measurements the fly agaric and porcini mushrooms are knit in chanterelle 3 / 7 5 cm tall the round from the top down in one piece the fly agaric 3 / 7 5cm tall chanterelle is knit also in the round but in 2 porcini 4 / 10 cm tall pieces the cap and the stem the houses doors spots and windows are made with embroidery approximate yardage the bottom of the mushrooms are left open so 7 yd/6 4 m or less of worsted yarn in each color that they stand better independently yarn abbreviations i used patons classic wool worsted because i k = knit like a firmer fabric that helps my houses to k2tog = knit 2 together decreasing 1 stitch stand independently my fly agaric and porcini kfb = knit into the front and back of the stitch houses work better in sock than my chanterelle increasing 1 stitch m1l = pick up the strand between the needles needles with the left needle tip from the front and knit one set of double-pointed needles dpns in size into the back of the loop 1 st increase us 2 2 75mm or size to obtain gauge m1r = pick up the bar between the sts from the back with the left needle and knit into the front gauge optional of the loop 1 st increase 6 sts and 6 row = 1 /2 5cm over stockinette p = purl supplies ssk = slip slip knit slip 2 stitches knit-wise one at a time to your right needle then return the stuffing for stems tapestry needle markers now-turned stitches back to the left needle video links knit them both together through the back loop how to perform a satin stitch decreasing 1
